volsense_core.data package

Submodules

volsense_core.data.data_utils module

get_or_fetch_multi(tickers, start='2000-01-01', end=None, lookback=21, use_cache=True)[source]

Fetch OHLCV and realized volatility for multiple tickers with optional caching.

On cache hit, returns the cached parquet. Otherwise, downloads data for all tickers and builds a unified dataset, then writes it to cache (if enabled) before returning.

Parameters:

  • tickers (list[str] or tuple[str, ...]) – Collection of ticker symbols to fetch.

  • start (str) – Start date (YYYY-MM-DD) for the time series.

  • end (str, optional) – End date (YYYY-MM-DD). If None, fetches up to the latest available date.

  • lookback (int) – Rolling window length used to compute realized volatility.

  • use_cache (bool) – Whether to read/write from local cache.

Raises:

ValueError – If the underlying fetch/build returns no valid data.

Returns:

Long-form dataset with [‘date’,’ticker’,’return’,’realized_vol’] across all tickers.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

get_or_fetch_single(ticker: str, start='2000-01-01', end=None, use_cache=True)[source]

Fetch OHLCV and realized volatility for a single ticker with optional caching.

On cache hit, returns the cached parquet. Otherwise, downloads data and builds the dataset, then writes it to cache (if enabled) before returning.

Parameters:

  • ticker (str) – Ticker symbol to fetch.

  • start (str) – Start date (YYYY-MM-DD) for the time series.

  • end (str, optional) – End date (YYYY-MM-DD). If None, fetches up to the latest available date.

  • use_cache (bool) – Whether to read/write from local cache.

Raises:

ValueError – If the underlying fetch/build returns no valid data.

Returns:

Long-form dataset with [‘date’,’ticker’,’return’,’realized_vol’].

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

load_from_cache(name: str) → DataFrame[source]

Load a DataFrame from parquet cache if it exists.

Parameters:

name (str) – Logical cache key (filename without extension).

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – If no cached parquet file exists for the given name.

Returns:

Cached DataFrame loaded from parquet.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

make_rolling_windows(df: DataFrame, window: int = 30, stride: int = 5)[source]

Generate rolling subwindows of a DataFrame for evaluation or backtesting.

The function creates overlapping slices of length window, advancing the start index by stride each step. Assumes the DataFrame includes a ‘date’ column.

Parameters:

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – Input time series; must include a ‘date’ column sorted ascending.

  • window (int) – Length of each rolling window.

  • stride (int) – Step size between window start indices.

Raises:

ValueError – If ‘date’ column is missing from the input DataFrame.

Returns:

List of rolling DataFrame segments, each of length window (except potentially the last if filtered elsewhere).

Return type:

list[pandas.DataFrame]

save_to_cache(df: DataFrame, name: str)[source]

Save a DataFrame to local parquet cache.

Parameters:

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame to be saved.

  • name (str) – Logical cache key (filename without extension).

Returns:

Filesystem path of the saved parquet file.

Return type:

pathlib.Path

volsense_core.data.feature_engineering module

add_calendar_features(df: DataFrame) → DataFrame[source]

Add calendar encodings and absolute return moments.

Computes:

  • day_of_week: normalized day index in [0,1] (Mon=0, Sun=1 via 6.0 divisor)

  • month_sin, month_cos: cyclical month encodings

  • abs_return: absolute daily return

  • ret_sq: squared daily return

Parameters:

df (pandas.DataFrame) – Input DataFrame containing ‘date’ and ‘return’.

Returns:

DataFrame with added calendar features.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

add_market_features(df: DataFrame, eps: float = 1e-06) → DataFrame[source]

Add cross-sectional market stress, its lag, and short-horizon return skew.

Computes:

  • market_stress: cross-sectional std of ‘return’ within each date

  • market_stress_1d_lag: per-ticker 1-day lag of market_stress

  • skew_5d: rolling 5-day skewness of returns (standardized), requires >= 3 observations

Parameters:

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – Input DataFrame with at least [‘date’,’ticker’,’return’].

  • eps (float) – Numerical stability constant used in skewness computation.

Returns:

DataFrame with added market-level features.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

add_rolling_features(df: DataFrame, eps: float = 1e-06) → DataFrame[source]

Add rolling volatility features and related derivatives.

Computes per-ticker:

  • vol_3d: 3-day mean of realized_vol

  • vol_10d: 10-day mean of realized_vol

  • vol_ratio: vol_3d / (vol_10d + eps)

  • vol_chg: vol_3d - vol_10d

  • vol_vol: 10-day std of realized_vol

  • ewma_vol_10d: EWMA of realized_vol with span=10

Parameters:

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – Input DataFrame containing at least [‘ticker’,’realized_vol’].

  • eps (float) – Numerical stability constant used in vol_ratio denominator.

Returns:

DataFrame with added rolling features.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

build_features(df: DataFrame, include=None, exclude=None) → DataFrame[source]

Build a full feature set with inclusion/exclusion controls.

Pipeline:

  1. compute_base_features

  2. add_rolling_features

  3. add_market_features

  4. add_calendar_features

  5. Filter to core columns + requested engineered features

Parameters:

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – Input DataFrame (raw OHLCV or long table with ‘return’ and ‘realized_vol’).

  • include (list[str] or None) – Feature names to include; if None, uses the default feature list.

  • exclude (list[str] or set[str] or None) – Feature names to exclude from the final set.

Raises:

  • ValueError – Propagated if base feature computation cannot infer dates.

  • KeyError – Propagated if required columns for returns are missing.

Returns:

Feature-enriched DataFrame sorted by [‘ticker’,’date’].

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

compute_base_features(df: DataFrame, eps: float = 1e-06, vol_lookback: int = 10) → DataFrame[source]

Compute and ensure core features exist on the input DataFrame.

Ensures and/or computes:

  • date (datetime) and ticker (defaults to ‘UNK’ if missing)

  • return: pct-change of Adj Close (or Close if Adj Close is absent)

  • realized_vol: rolling std of return over vol_lookback, annualized by sqrt(252)

  • realized_vol_log: log(realized_vol + eps)

Accepts either raw OHLCV (with ‘Adj Close’/’Close’) or a long-form dataset that already contains ‘return’ and optionally ‘realized_vol’.

Parameters:

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – Input DataFrame with either raw OHLCV or precomputed returns/volatility.

  • eps (float) – Numerical stability constant added before log.

  • vol_lookback (int) – Rolling window (in days) for realized volatility.

Raises:

  • ValueError – If ‘date’ is missing and index is not a DatetimeIndex.

  • KeyError – If ‘return’ must be computed but neither ‘Adj Close’ nor ‘Close’ is present.

Returns:

DataFrame with core columns computed and sorted by [‘ticker’,’date’].

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

volsense_core.data.fetch module

build_dataset(tickers: str | List[str], start: str = '2000-01-01', end: str | None = None, window: int = 15, cache_dir: str | None = None, show_progress: bool = True) → DataFrame[source]

Fetch raw OHLCV data and build a standardized volatility dataset.

Computes daily returns from adjusted close (if available, else close) and realized volatility as a rolling standard deviation over the given window, annualized by sqrt(252).

Parameters:

  • tickers (str or list[str]) – Single ticker symbol or list of tickers to include.

  • start (str) – Start date for the download (YYYY-MM-DD).

  • end (str, optional) – End date for the download (YYYY-MM-DD). If None, fetches up to the latest available date.

  • window (int) – Rolling window length (in trading days) used to compute realized volatility.

  • cache_dir (str, optional) – Optional directory for CSV caching during fetch.

  • show_progress (bool) – Whether to display a tqdm progress bar for multi-ticker fetches.

Raises:

ValueError – If no valid data is returned for any ticker.

Returns:

Tidy DataFrame sorted by [‘ticker’,’date’] with columns [‘date’,’ticker’,’return’,’realized_vol’].

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

fetch_ohlcv(tickers: str | List[str], start: str = '2000-01-01', end: str | None = None, show_progress: bool = True, cache_dir: str | None = None) → DataFrame | Dict[str, DataFrame][source]

Fetch OHLCV data for one or more tickers from Yahoo Finance.

Parameters:

  • tickers (str or list[str]) – Single ticker symbol or list of tickers.

  • start (str) – Start date for the download (YYYY-MM-DD).

  • end (str, optional) – End date for the download (YYYY-MM-DD). If None, fetches up to the latest available date.

  • show_progress (bool) – Whether to display a tqdm progress bar for multi-ticker requests.

  • cache_dir (str, optional) – Optional directory to cache each ticker’s data as CSV. If provided and a cache exists, it will be reused.

Returns:

For a single ticker, a DataFrame with columns [‘date’,’open’,’high’,’low’,’close’,’adj_close’,’volume’]. For multiple tickers, a dict mapping ticker to its DataFrame.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame or dict[str, pandas.DataFrame]
